titleInfo.title: Letter, David L. Jones in Nashville, Tenn. to Anna Jones in Allegheny City, Pa., 1865 April 26

mods.abstract: Union soldier, David L. Jones wrote to his sons from Nashville on April 26, 1865. He mentioned that his son, James, wanted David to keep the letters he received from James. He mentioned he wanted to hear more about and from the others. He talked about fruit he'd seen and asked about their grapes and the weather. He told them about the weather in Nashville. He told them to behave. He enclosed a paper and a letter to his wife. He told her he was well and hoped that she and the children were well, also. He mentioned some man that was in the hospital and another man that had been there that was well. He mentioned some may be discharged.
